name: Old Town Glassworks
description: Since 1994, Old Town Glassworks (formerly Yellowknife Glass Recyclers) has produced and sold top-quality northern glassware featuring original designs and recycled materials. The product is highly regarded and of excellent quality. Created by Matthew Grogono, the company came into existence attempting to find a way to transform unwanted glass bottles from the Yellowknife waste stream into useful decorative glassware. Operating from a small building located in the “Old Town” Yellowknife, the business evolved a method of creating drinking glasses, bowls, vases, candle holders and other assorted glassware from the unwanted bottles. Each piece of glassware is fully finished, handcrafted and etched with original northern designs.

name: Wynn Capital Management
description: Wynn Capital Management was founded in 2003 by derivatives trader Thomas Wynn.  After an 11 year career as an options market maker on the Pacific Stock Exchange, Thomas sought to implement the advanced strategies, technology and latest academic research for the benefit of average investors.

name: Lafes
description: Lafes is an award winning natural and organic personal care brand with a twenty year history of creating healthy plant based products that promote sustainable living practices and  strong environmental stewardship.  Lafes offers an extensive line of certified organic deodorants, babycare and haircare products, taking pride in the company’s formulations that follow from the founder's mother’s simple adage regarding ingredients, “if you can’t pronounce them, avoid them.”

name: POMADA
description: POMADA is an enterprise and workshop space that inspires the creative reuse of waste. Besides being a smart way of using raw material, it is a message. The cyclical concept of sustainability, a trend that points to a horizon where the man and his environment lead to a harmonious and symbiotic coexistence, is present in recycling.

name: Manitoba Harvest Hemp Foods
description: Manitoba Harvest Hemp Foods is the world’s largest hemp foods manufacturer to grow, make and sell their own line of hemp food products. Manitoba Harvest’s award-winning products like Hemp Hearts raw shelled hemp seeds and Hemp Pro 70 protein concentrate are found at thousands of retailers across North America.

name: Criando Consultoria
description: Criando Consultoria is a consulting firm that provides services to NGOs, foundations, associations, and public and private organizations that want to actively participate in cultural development and the social economy.

name: Gardener's Supply Company
description: Gardener’s Supply is 100% employee-owned and was founded in 1983 by a handful of enthusiastic Vermont gardeners.  Today, the company serves millions of gardeners nationwide and is known for its’ award-winning gardening products.  Though the company has grown, it remains passionately committed to help people experience the joys of gardening in harmony with nature.

name: Louder
description: Louder gives everyone access to powerful advertising tools to amplify ideas that matter. With their “Make it Louder” buttons, users can fund the promotion of content to reach new targeted audiences.

name: Prosperity Candle
description: Today Prosperity Candle creates unique luxury candles, custom designed corporate and event gifts, and now the newest and boldest product, the Forever Candle. With a lifetime of complimentary refills, this artisan crafted candle offers unlimited impact. The perfect gift for everyone who believes in a brighter future for all.

name: Impact Hub Seattle
description: Impact Hub Seattle is a community workspace where individuals and teams are part of an entrepreneurial community. Monthly members also have access to events, programming and mentorship to help accelerate everyone toward individual and business goals.

name: Headwater Foods
description: Headwater Foods Inc. is a diverse and integrated, soil-to-table, community food enterprise that creates a value-filled, year round supply chain of local, top quality, sustainable foods for the Genesee Finger Lakes area of New York and the Northeast region of the United States.  In the last five years of operation, Headwater Foods has used both wholesale and direct sales strategies to grow 100% each year and establish itself as a leading supplier of local, sustainable foods and an organization working to positively transform the region’s food system. The company seeks to promote local, sustainable agriculture; a regional food system; accessible and fair GOOD FOOD options for all people; and an enhancement and celebration of Western New York’s food history and culture.

name: Talent Nation
description: Talent Nation is an executive recruitment and search firm with a core focus on Environment, Sustainability, Energy, and the Not for Profit sector. They operate as a focal point in their areas of specialisation, creating communities of talent for both clients and candidates to interact with. Talent Nation’s expertise lies in identifying individuals that align both culturally and technically with organisations that engage them. Talent Nation’s goal is to create a community of business leaders who will influence organisations to achieve effective social, environmental and economic outcomes.

name: Komodo OpenLab Inc.
description: Komodo OpenLab develops inclusive technologies that facilitate the daily lives of people with disabilities.

name: QoC Health
description: QoC Health enables patient centered care with mobile solutions, new service delivery models, and cloud computing.

name: Message Agency
description: They are a full-service interactive studio and social enterprise based in Philadelphia that helps nonprofits and sustainable businesses use technology to enlighten, educate, engage, and enact change. Their messaging, branding, design, web development, and systems integration services help you tell your story, engage your supporters, manage your relationships, and increase your bottom line.

name: Gulliver
description: Gulliver is an innovative agency comprised of an experienced team of consultants whose experience is backed by the results their customers have obtained.

name: Maritime Tidal Energy Corporation
description: Maritime Tidal Energy Corporation (MTEC) is a marine renewable energy consulting company focused on fulfilling the services needs of the tidal energy sector.  Their mission is to be the high quality, solutions-oriented, professional services provider of choice for the global marine renewable energy industry.  Their goal is to facilitate the development of marine energy while maintaining their responsibility to their stakeholders, the communities in which they operate, and the integrity of the environment.

name: 2b Design
description: 2b design is an award-winning company which transforms architectural salvage from conflict zones and other reclaimed materials into high end home décor. Currently the company operates out of Beirut, Lebanon and Cambridge, MA, USA. 2b design trains and employs directly and indirectly marginalized and disabled men and women to enable them to become world class artisans and enjoy a dignified living.  The company involves in its work people of diverse backgrounds to promote reconciliation. Its flagship brand is called Beyt which means House or Home in semitic languages. 2b design is often referred to as Beyt by 2b design.

name: Emmy's Organics
description: Emmy's Organics produces certified vegan, gluten-free and non-gmo power foods. The company was created by Founders, Ian Gaffney and Samantha Abrams in Ian's mother's home kitchen. The goal was to create healthy, energizing snacks to sell to their community and local farmer's market. After only a few months, the couple realized that this was more than just a passion project. So, they got to work! After years of many company transformations and lessons learned, Emmy's products are distributed nationally and in Canada. Their products range from a line of macaroons that come in seven flavors, a jarred chocolate sauce and, launching in January 2014, a line of Super Cereals, all based in sprouted buckwheat. Health, Well-Being and Having It All --- that's Emmy's.

name: Tiffinday Inc.
description: Tiffinday is a “boutique” food business specializing in plant-based South Asian meals made from ingredients that use up the least amount of the Earth’s resources.  Founded in 2010 with a simple focus on the lunch-time customer, Tiffinday’s started delivering freshly-made meals to offices in downtown Toronto in Tiffins, stacked stainless steel lunch boxes, which were collected back, making the meals completely litter-less.  While the Tiffin Lunch service continues grow in popularity at boardroom meetings as well as for busy individuals weary of mass produced food court fare, Tiffinday’s delicious food is now also available at popular Farmers’ Markets in Toronto, where their supply chain is nicely integrated with local farmers; in the Spring of 2014 they will launch of a line of their most popular ready-to-eat curries, pressure-canned in mason jars, available for sale at retail stores in Toronto.

name: Y Scouts
description: Y Scouts is a leadership and executive search firm that connects purpose-driven organizations with purpose-driven leaders. Y Scouts believes that people are the only real competitive advantage in business and that best employer/employee connections start by connecting through a shared purpose.

name: Social Enterprises Inc.
description: Social Enterprises, Inc. exists to serve non-profit and impact-minded organizations working to create a better world. Their mission is to assist these organizations in developing events that strengthen their networks and influence while generating funds to support ongoing work.

name: USEED
description: USEED is a startup dedicated to redesigning philanthropy in HigherEd. They empower schools with the next evolution of peer-to-peer fundraising that increases new donors, engages students and alumni, and creates more experiential learning experiences.

name: Broota SPA
description: Broota is a Latin American Entrepreneurship Network. They also fund entrepreneurs through Equity Based or Investment Crowdfunding.

name: Ondul_
description: Ondulé is a company that promotes children's creativity, imagination and communication through toys made of recycled cardboard. It also generates social impact by providing work to young people without education and experience.

name: OluKai
description: OluKai is a luxury lifestyle brand that believes everyone, no matter where they are, can live Aloha. OluKai is one way to unlock its spirit in all of us. The company is committed to building a unique and better class of products that blend ocean heritage with modern performance while leaving the smallest footprint possible on the planet

name: City of Roses Disposal & Recycling Inc
description: City of Roses Disposal & Recycling (CORDR) is an integrated waste & recycling organization that emphasizes its main focal point on, assisting businesses with reducing their carbon footprint.

name: Interface Sustainable Constructions
description: The mission at Interface Sustainable Constructions is to provide sustainable building options at an industry competitive price. They aim to encourage all their customers to opt for a life cycle assessment of their building so they are aware of their carbon emissions and can then choose how to offset their emissions. They believe that buildings can have a positive impact on climate change as new materials and technologies arise. Interface currently recycles about 90%+ waste on construction sites and carbon offset all projects. As a green company they are always researching new buildings materials that can replace toxic ones at competitive prices.

name: God and Christ Care, LLC
description: God & Christ Care provides superior care to their clients through their health and wellness plans. They hire only licensed and highly skilled nurses, therapists, and caregivers to provide high quality health care. In addition to hiring only the best employees, God & Christ Care unfailingly provides their employees with extensive benefits. They seek to be recognized as a company who does business differently through the treatment of their employees, the environment, their patients, and the community. God & Christ Care puts people before profits, but maintains both financial viability and fiscal responsibility.

name: Casa e Cafe
description: Casa e Café's mission is to offer the most intelligent technology for hiring domestic professionals, to serve as a vector of social transformation for the base of the pyramid, and to promote a better quality of life for those in the domestic service industry and their families.

name: Estancia Beef
description: Estancia Beef is a market leader and innovator in pasture-raised, grass-fed beef.  The beef is raised on farms (never in feedlots) without the use of hormones or antibiotics - it is authentic, healthy, great-tasting, and good for the planet.  Estancia is sold in fine restaurants and high-quality supermarkets across the US.   The Company’s unique quality-control standards and production capabilities are clear points of differentiation and help them meet a growing consumer demand for healthy, safe, and sustainably-raised grass-fed beef.

name: thrdPlace
description: thrdPlace works to improve our shared communities, by connecting all stakeholders within a marketplace of needs and resources.  first by helping organizations, communicate and manage thework they do in local communities, thrdPlace increases the distribution of resources into those communities.

name: Fresh City Farms, Inc.
description: Fresh City delivers local and organic food to thousands in the Toronto area each week.  By farming right in the city, Fresh City changes the way people eat by bringing makers and eaters closer together.  Fresh City works with a network of other local makers that are certified fair trade, local, organic and B Corporations, to provide a full and convenient grocery solution.

name: Purpose STAFF
description: DePaul Industries is the Northwest's most comprehensive outsourcing specialist. For over 40 years, DePaul Industries has served some of America's best-run companies by providing flexible staffing, security, and packaging solutions to solve business problems.

name: Moye White
description: Moye White LLP is a Denver law firm serving clients throughout Colorado, the Rocky Mountain West, nationally and internationally. With approximately 50 attorneys, they provide legal representation across a wide variety of transactional and litigation matters. The firm’s attorneys offer strategic, team-oriented counsel to public, private and governmental clients in complex business and real estate transactions and disputes.  Moye White is recognized by LexisNexis® Martindale-Hubbell® as a 2014 Top Ranked Law Firm.™

name: Jeni's Splendid Ice Creams
description: Jeni Britton Bauer opened Jeni's Splendid Ice Creams in 2002 in Columbus, Ohio's historic North Market, and now with her small team operates 15 shops from Chicago to Atlanta. Pints and ice cream sandwiches are also available at more than 900 US groceries, as well as online through Jeni's home-shipping business.

name: Business Development Bank of Canada
description: Canada’s business development bank, BDC puts entrepreneurs first. With almost 2,000 employees and more than 100 business centres across the country, BDC offers financing, subordinate financing, venture capital and consulting services to more than 28,000 small and medium-sized companies. Their success is vital to Canada’s economic prosperity.

name: Green Canopy Homes
description: GREEN CANOPY rebuilds Seattle homes with quality, energy efficiency, and today’s lifestyles in mind. Their mission is to inspire resource efficiency by re-using and remodeling homes with sustainable and efficient methods and materials. Green Canopy is more than just an urban developer – they think long-term about their impact on the environment and the communities in which they build.

name: Corktown Seed Co.
description: Corktown Seed Co. is a communications firm that helps clients uncover and leverage their brand values for growth. The research is clear. Citizen consumers are on the rise. They vote, donate, volunteer and purchase, all through the lens of their personal, deeply held values. Corktown Seed Co. helps businesses and non-profits connect with this growing constituency.

name: Blue Hill Partners LLC
description: Blue Hill Partners is an energy services company that provides specialty energy efficiency retrofits as a fully funded, turnkey service.  The Company partners with best-in-class technology, engineering and construction partners. They fund and manage the entire process: assessment, design, engineering, installation, and commissioning.  Blue Hill also monitors and maintains the equipment and covers the labor and equipment costs of any product failure over the term of the service agreement.  The Company provides user-friendly reports and analysis to support the client’s operations and sustainability reporting objectives. Clients have no out of pocket costs for the retrofits, and pay a service fee to Blue Hill over the service term for the efficiency, maintenance, and monitoring services. These payments are based on the actual energy savings of the upgrades – so Blue Hill is only successful when the projected savings are achieved. The cost of the new energy bill plus Blue Hill’s services fee is typically less than the client’s pre-retrofit energy bill.   Blue Hill’s goal is to make it easy and efficient to be energy efficient. Blue Hill currently offers two specialty solutions: outdoor lighting retrofits and science building ventilation upgrades.

name: L. International
description: L. International is a condom company with a cause; to support women globally by focusing on their sexual empowerment. They create the highest quality condoms for the modern consumer in safety, comfort, and design. Their brand represents a movement for consumers' choice to support better sex, a better cause, and a better world. Core to their company mission, L. partners with development organizations to support women and HIV/AIDS prevention.

name: CafeGive
description: CafeGive Social is a social and mobile applications and cause marketing solutions company, whose platform and services empower companies and nonprofits to build effective social media campaigns around causes and community engagement. CafeGive Social provides companies with the tools they need to drive corporate philanthropy, and create deeper, more meaningful conn

name: Nature's Fare Markets
description: Established twenty years ago in Kelowna, British Columbia, Nature’s Fare has grown to become the Okanagan’s natural food retailer of choice. A family owned and operated business, Nature’s Fare has six locations across the province as well as a head office, a central warehouse and a commissary kitchen. Nature’s Fare has a distinct internal culture and loyal employees who are responsible for its success. Employees are given every opportunity for growth and are provided with advanced educational and training experiences as well as rewarded with competitive bonuses and benefits plans.

name: TSSS
description: The Toronto Sustainability Speaker Series (TSSS) is widely recognized as Canada’s premiere forum for dialogue and problem solving among sustainability professionals.

name: CAL Insurance & Assoc. Inc.
description: In 1927, Cyril Anthony Lagomarsino founded a real estate/insurance business called CAL Insurance and CAL Realty. The name of the businesses, contrary to most people’s belief, has nothing to do with the state of California or the University of California, but Cyril’s initials.

name: Sustainable Business Consulting
description: Sustainable Business Consulting (SBC) is a Seattle-based consulting firm focused on demonstrating the bottom-line business benefits of sustainability and leading companies through successful implementation. They bring nearly three decades of experience working with businesses ranging from Fortune 500 multinationals to medium-sized businesses. SBC’s clients include Nordstrom, REI, The North Face, Alaska Airlines, Redbox, Expeditors, Drugstore.com, Puget Sound Energy and more than 75 others.

name: MaineWorks, LLC
description: MaineWorks is a temporary staffing company providing meaningful work opportunities within the field of industrial construction. Their employees are generally in recovery from substance abuse, have previous drug or alcohol related felonies, come from low socio-economic backgrounds, are new Americans or Veterans - or face other real barriers to employment. Along with meaningful job placement, MaineWorks’ employees participate in a comprehensive needs evaluation through our WorkWell program so that they can be directed to appropriate social services within the community. They offer this unique resource to better the lives of their employees as well as convert them from tax burden to tax payer.

name: MAX Insurance
description: Mutual Aid eXchange (MAX) is a member-owned enterprise that provides insurance the way it should be; fair, faithful and socially responsible.  They offer a full range of competitively priced auto, homeowners, farm, business, life and related forms of insurance in most U.S. states and five Canadian provinces.  In many cases, they can match or even save you money over your current insurance.

name: Down to Earth Markets
description: Down to Earth Markets bring together two kinds of vendors: local farmers and area food makers who source locally. In selecting food makers, the company evaluates vendors on a range of criteria, including transparency in sourcing, connection to community, and environmental stewardship. By incorporating qualified producers into their markets, Down to Earth expands upon the traditional farmers market. More local food entrepreneurs find a venue to sell their products directly to shoppers. In turn, shoppers benefit by discovering a greater offering of local foods at the markets. Best yet, regional agriculture thrives, as more businesses source from area farms.

name: Cubiertosdemadera.com
description: Cubiertosdemadera.com was founded in order to reduce the usage of disposable plastic products by bringing alternatives through design, innovation and quality as well as a 100% compostable line of alternatives.

name: The Delphi Group
description: The Delphi Group is a strategic consultancy that has helped its clients and partners over the past 25 years integrate environmental, social and financial issues into their organizational culture in a manner that generates multiple benefits.

name: GreenPlanet Bio-Fuels
description: Green Planet Bio-­Fuels Inc. is a family owned and operated business in Toronto, Ontario, Canada, for the purposes of recycling waste cooking oil from restaurants, hotels, shopping centres and food manufacturers in Southern Ontario, with all oils collected being used as the feedstock of biofuel as a clean, alternative energy source.

name: Emprendejoven
description: Emprendejoven is a company that creates and develops life and work skills education programs. They have developed a methodology that is called "Learn by failing" which it is certified by the Chile Foundation.

name: Turbo
description: Turbo Aceleradora accelerates the growth of positive impact companies in Brazil. They believe business must take into account the needs of all its stakeholders as well as its social and environmental impact. Turbo also works with NGO’s through an entrepreneurship approach and with regular corporations by introducing a sustainability attitude to their business.

name: New Earth Athens
description: New Earth Athens is a purpose-driven company providing a unique event center specializing in sustainable event production, entertainment, and healthy living for the community of Athens, GA.

name: Skiba Consulting, Ltd.
description: Businesses with Heart often struggle with getting purpose and profit heading in the same direction.  Skiba Consulting helps them to attain better alignment, so that as they grow and make more money they're also increasing their social impact.

name: Make a Stand Inc.
description: Make a Stand didn't start as a product. It started as a promise—in the heart of a little girl. One year ago, then eight year-old Vivienne Harr saw a

name: Cook Trading Ltd
description: In 1997, Cook Trading set out to make remarkable meals for the freezer using exactly the same ingredients you would at home, so everything looks and tastes homemade.  Today, nothing has changed (except that they're a bit better at it).

name: evolveEA
description: evolve environment :: architecture (evolveEA) is a nimble multidisciplinary practice situated at the intersection of sustainability and the built environment. The team of designers, architects, environmental scientists and sustainable business experts look through three lenses of sustainability: People, Process, and Place.

name: Hugo Neu Recycling
description: Hugo Neu Recycling, a woman- and minority-owned company based in the New York region, provides commercial, governmental and non-profit institutions with turnkey solutions for their end-of-life electronics. Known for its leadership in developing responsible certification standards for IT asset management and recycling, Hugo Neu Recycling is certified to the e-Stewards© and ISO 14001 standards, and has NAID-certified facilities. The processing locations in the Northeast are home to state-of-the-art technology for safe data destruction in compliance with applicable data privacy laws, and serve as the base for sortation and recycling of electronics, as well as extensive reuse and resale of working equipment. A client-centric, customized approach offers value for organizations looking to responsibly and efficiently manage their IT assets. The end-to-end service offerings include: material pick-up; audit and testing; refurbishment and remarketing; and universal waste sorting and processing.

name: Talgra
description: Talgra offers consulting services for people wanting to apply new thinking to create positive social and environmental change with their money while providing a financial return.  The company guides people about values-based investing opportunities from local banking to energy conservation projects to funding social entrepreneurs.  Talgra offers related services focused on achieving successful investments of time and money for purpose driven people and organizations.  Talgra's consulting approach is based on experience from the company’s own portfolio of community, sustainable and impact investments.  To provide a roadmap for anyone looking to align their money and values, Talgra created and sponsors the Money and Impact Investing Directory.

name: BlueDot
description: BlueDot (formerly known as BioDiaspora) develops risk assessment technology that enables global leaders to accurately predict and anticipate how emerging infectious disease threats will spread around the world. This capability was scientifically validated during the 2009 H1N1 influenza pandemic and published in the New England Journal of Medicine. BlueDot technology is extensively used by United States Centers for Disease Control, World Health Organization, Public Health Agency of Canada, and other leading institutions that seek to mitigate against the health and economic risks of infectious diseases. BlueDot technology is an advanced web-based enterprise solution that has an integrated live stream of global epidemic intelligence from worldwide infectious disease surveillance systems and contextualizes these threats by integrating an extensive number of datasets pertaining to human and animal populations, climate, health system environments, economic conditions, and many other factors. BlueDot users can conduct in-depth analysis of the continuously evolving architecture of the global airline transportation network and the origins, travel routes, and destinations of more than two billion passengers who pass through it every year.

name: SPUD
description: Sustainable Produce Urban Delivery (SPUD) offers all the amenities of a traditional grocery store with the added convenience of online shopping. All of SPUD’s products are either certified organic, natural, or locally and sustainably made. SPUD believes that getting local, organic food delivered to your door is one of the easiest and most powerful ways to improve health, protect the environment, and support the local community.

name: Impact Tech Pty Ltd
description: Impact Tech Pty Ltd is a tech company for the social sector. Their core product is a social project management platform specifically design for organisations and businesses that are seeking positive change in the world.

name: Microgrid Energy, LLC
description: Microgrid Solar is a solar PV developer and EPC contractor based in St. Louis, MO, offering turnkey solar services for commercial, government, and residential clients. Microgrid has installed over 400 solar projects in 7 states and the Caribbean. Microgrid Solar is a division of Microgrid Energy, which provides a broader range of clean energy services.

name: Better Bean Company
description: Better Bean blossomed from founder Keith Kullberg’s recipe for refried beans that originated in his vegetarian youth. A favorite of his daughters, Keith would cook up his special recipe at least once of month, despite the lengthy process of the recipe. The delicious flavor and texture of their beloved beans inspired the Kullberg family to found The Better Bean Company. To preserve the quality of taste, the Kullbergs pioneered a new grocery category: fresh, ready-to-eat beans sold in the refrigerated section. Better Beans are now sold across the United States and Canada through premium and natural food retailers.

name: Inspiring Capital
description: Inspiring Capital is fueled by a passion for effective, innovative, and sustainable social change driven by business-minded social entrepreneurs and their ventures. They are building a community of forward-looking businesses and individuals who share this passion and are committed to using proven business strategies to change the world. Within this community, Inspiring Capital optimizes relationships between not-for-profit organizations and their donors, integrating the strengths, assets, and weaknesses of each to create more of the change they both seek.

name: Tree Planet
description: Tree Planet seeks impact by tackling two issues: Firstly, not enough trees are being planted to replace those lost every year, and secondly, the response of the stakeholder (civic society, corporations, NGOs and governments) is not coordinated. By proposing innovative win-win solutions so that all stakeholders enjoy added layers of incentives, Tree Planet purposes to combat climate change, desertification, donor fatigue and philanthropic inefficiencies.

name: Shark Island Productions Pty Ltd
description: Shark Island Productions is an award winning independent documentary company based in Sydney. Shark Island Productions aims to educate, entertain and make a significant social impact with their films. They create extensive education, outreach and community engagement campaigns to draw attention to a number of important social issues and make a difference. Shark Island builds strategic partnerships with foundations, philanthropists and not-for-profit organizations to connect with a broader audience and bring about sustainable social change. They consistently and regularly measure the impact of their films within the communities that they work.

name: Opulent Group
description: Opulent Group is a reputable property developer and operator,  recognized for the quality of their work and the excellence of their people, whilst positively impacting the communities in which they operate socially and environmentally.

name: Falcon Waterfree Technologies
description: Falcon Waterfree Technologies was formed with a vision: to promote conservation of the Earth's precious supply of fresh water and support sustainable resource management by becoming the leading waterless urinal system provider in the world.

name: Flipside Creative
description: Flipside Creative is a marketing and design studio that does great work for good people. No jerks.

name: CoopMetrics
description: CoopMetrics is a MN 308B cooperative which helps community based businesses compete with big box competitors by providing Fortune 500 quality business intelligence tools.

name: Adjacent Consulting
description: Adjacent helps you build emotionally agile teams and develop emotionally agile leaders.

name: Therafit Shoe
description: Therafit Shoe is a fashion-forward footwear brand with a patented Personal Comfort System dedicated to a women’s whole body wellness. Therafit believes that each and every person can make a difference. The company enables its’ customers to take the first step with our One Step Forward Giving Campaign. With each purchase, Therafit Shoe donates to a charity partner of the customer’s choice. Proceeds go directly to organizations that focus on medical research, education, and the preservation of our planet and its resources.  Therafit’s goal in social responsibility is to give back even more via charitable outreach and empowerment initiatives dedicated to programs of interest to women all across the country.

name: Solidarity Capital Group
description: Solidarity Capital Group is an impact investment firm that finances economically sustainable social justice enterprises.  Solidarity Capital Group creates opportunities for investors to back innovative social entrepreneurs, so they can extend their important work serving marginalized people and needs in their community.

name: Just Right Recycling
description: Just Right Recycling is a metal recycling company providing efficient bin services to industry. They have a passion for environmental stewardship and helping children who have been disadvantaged by the issues of exploitation.

name: Animana
description: Animana strives to produce timeless products which are created in Patagonia and the Andes using the rich local tradition of arts and crafts. These include textiles, home products, and accessories, which exude both quality and comfort. Animana was recently certified as a B Corp! Please check back soon for an updated profile or visit Animana's website.

name: Hawaiian Ola
description: Kona, HI-based Hawaiian Ola (

name: MAFIA
description: MAFIA creates one-of-a-kind bags and accessories from recycled sails, kites, and other sports equipment. Each product is made of more than 90% recycled materials. MAFIA also works along NGOs to give unemployed people the opportunity to work in the production of MAFIA's bags.

name: Bioplanet Corp.
description: Bioplanet Corp manufactures and distributes environmentally-friendly disposable packaging and tableware to make this world a better place to live in. Bioplanet Corp. accepts that in our society the usage of disposable cups, plates, trays, bowls, take-out containers, trash bags and cutlery is part of everyday life and to try to stop it would be almost impossible, so they believe that for disposable items to 1) come from a sustainable renewable resource and 2) not harm the environment when discarded. That way, products don’t use limited resources (like oil) to make disposable items that will be used only for a few minutes, only to end up in landfills for years to come or even worse…floating in our oceans.

name: Jackson River
description: Jackson River is a technology consulting firm that works with select influential nonprofits, cause-based initiatives, and progressive foundations. Their purpose is to support and strengthen organizations doing good work in the world by tailoring technology to enhance the impact of a cause. They are a primarily virtual company, with employees all over the country, headquarters in Washington DC and growing contingents in Austin, TX, San Francisco, CA and Raleigh-Durham, NC.

name: EcoWatch
description: EcoWatch, one of the nation’s leading online environmental platforms, educates and motivates people to protect human health and the environment.

name: Insamar
description: INSAMAR produces reformed tires, using tires whose useful life has ended and solid tires from tire waste process sub-products and scrap of other processes. With these actions, INSAMAR solves the specific problem of the elimination and difficult disposal or degradation of products in today's society. INSAMAR solves social and environmental problems through establishing commitments to international standards requirements ISO 9001: 14001 and OHSAS 18.001, that regulates these issues. INSAMAR has certified an integrated management system that includes commitments to quality production, with respect to the environment and health and safety of their workers and visits. Our About Us has an Integrated Management Policy where INSAMAR includes clear commitments and also trains its personnel on the achieving the requirements of the rules above mentioned.

name: Living Room Realty
description: Living Room Realty is a group of professional, experienced, licensed real estate agents who specialize in Portland’s inner urban neighborhoods. They offer full service representation to buyers and sellers and a full menu of relocation servicesincluding tenant placement and property management. Their expertise spans from vintage homes and historic neighborhoods to modern architecture and green building. The company’s agents are down-to-earth, experienced professionals who deliver the highest level of personalized service.  Living Room agents are committed to living and doing business with meaning.

name: Analytica Advisors Inc.
description: Analytica Advisors is focused on strengthening the global and domestic success of the Canadian clean technology industry and innovation-based companies that are core to the industry. Their mission is to build, in a sustainable and ethical manner, a research and advisory business that promotes economic growth of public and private sector organizations providing environmental and social benefits. Analytica Advisors was recently certified as a B Corp! Please check back soon for an updated profile or visit Analytica Advisors' website.

name: Teatulia Organic Teas
description: A great-tasting tea that’s better for the land, its people and the environment? A lofty goal, yes. And one Teatulia Organic Teas is proud to have achieved. Their organic tea garden is cultivated using only natural farming practices, and the revolutionary education, health and cattle-lending programs Teatulia Organic Teas has created provide a bright future for the Bangladeshi families who help produce their tea. And all of Teatulia’s teas are minimally packaged in sustainable, compostable style. This all adds up to a better tea experience.

name: Ematris

name: Degraf Ltda
description: DEGRAF is a family business that began operations in 1982 with the objective to recycle waste from the printing industry. DEGRAF's policy of quality, environmental commitment and responsiveness to new challenges, has resulted in steady growth. DEGRAF recycles products from Sony, Samsung, Canon, Hewlett Packard, ADT, SQM and NCR, and has expanded business operations into destruction of information and strategic assets. The close proximity of DEGRAF recycling facilities to the city center and the ability to closely monitor the recycling process has resulted in an increase in parties utilizing its service. DEGRAF has also become an alternative for the management of hazardous waste, including lead-acid batteries, fluorescent tubes, batteries and toner.

name: ChangeIt

Charitable organizations can quickly and securely register their organization for participation and begin collecting charitable donations. It is free to register and once registration is complete organizations will gain unlimited access to a variety of valuable marketing and promotional material at no additional cost. There is a nominal administrative service fee that is remitted back to ChangeIt® and is only ever payable upon the receipt of a donation – so charities never pay additional out of pocket fees!

description: While medieval alchemists sought to turn lead into gold, Alchemy Goods strives to turn useless stuff like blown-out inner tubes, old seatbelts and advertising banners into useful products like bags and wallets. Another word for this is upcycling. Recycling turns a substance into the same thing over and over again. Upcycling turns something of lesser value into something of greater value.

name: M_s Ambiente S.A.
description: Mas ambiente is dedicated to the manufacturing of ecofriendly products that reconnect people and their communities. The company manufactures ecofriendly soaps made with 100% recycled cooking oil. After being subjected to a purification treatment, the soap is revalued and transformed with natural elements such as leaves and seeds. The process saves water, and is unique because most by-products are biodegradable and do not contain chemicals such as petroleum. The soaps are made by women in vulnerable neighborhoods who enter the supplier development program and become entrepreneurs; creating a new income for families and assisting in their own personal development.

description: Womenetics, based in Atlanta, Georgia, is a multi-dimensional media platform providing women with an ongoing and expanding source of essential tools and knowledge necessary to boost business success. With more than half of the US workforce made up of women, companies are recognizing the value a diversified workforce delivers — from innovation, creativity, and collaboration to increased revenues. Womenetics works to foster and channel the talents of women to help fuel emergence and growth within their specific fields and ultimately throughout our world.

This is accomplished by partnering with K-12 schools to make the shift to 21st century learning. World Leadership School helps their schools create student-centered learning environments where students learn to think critically, communicate across cultures, collaborate and find creative solutions to problems. In the process, young leaders find their voices.

name: Wire Media

We believe your work should be something you love to do, and that it should be an integrated part of your life that is meaningful and valuable to you and to others.  We believe in the power of design to create real social change. As a design and communications agency, we apply our design and communications skills in a way that ultimately helps improve lives and communities.

name: World Centric
description: World Centric’s mission is to create a better world. They started out as a non-profit and now as a business, they remain an organization not driven by profits but by their values. They manufacture compostable products which replace single use plastics & Styrofoam disposables/packaging, donate 25% of their profits to grassroots social and environmental organizations, offset all their carbon emissions from raw materials to final delivery, give discounts to schools and non-profits, and continuously try to make a difference for the better.

name: Wendel, Rosen, Black & Dean LLP

The firm is committed to maintaining the high level of trust and personalized attention that clients have come to expect. Founded in 1909, the firm’s community roots are deep, but its approach to practice is forward thinking.

Purpose Capital marries deep experience in investment banking, consulting and advisory services, impact assessment, and social entrepreneurship to design and realize solutions that matter to the world.

name: TriLibrium
description: TriLibrium breaks the mold of Certified Public Accounting firms. The accounting profession is full of people who prepare tax returns, audit financial statements, project cash flow and otherwise account for the financial bottom line. Where conventional firms see those services as the sum total of their business, they view them as a starting point towards building sustainable communities. You notice the difference immediately in their name: TriLibrium is a synthesis of triple bottom line and equilibrium. “Triple bottom line” captures their commitment to the mutually supportive values—people, planet, profit—that distinguish a sustainable business. “Equilibrium” refers to their commitment to establish balance among the three bottom lines in all that they do for their clients and as a firm.

name: TriCiclos
description: TriCiclos is a company created to make sustainability contagious. As Jay Coen Gilbert said, “TriCiclos is a tool for promoting sustainability and citizenship, masquerading as a recycling company”. TriCiclos offers Puntos Limpios (clean points) for citizens and companies to learn to recycle and become conscious consumers, acting to solve the problems of waste management. Working where there are no existing solutions, TriCiclos recycles some 20 materials, most of which have very low commercial value, promising that every material received is effectively recycled. TriCiclos supports companies, schools, and other organizations that want to learn how to act in a more sustainable way, and sells products with low environmental impact to support sustainable habits.

With four NABCEP-certified installers and a NABCEP-certified Technical Sales representative on staff, they supply consulting/design services and full turnkey solutions for new and retrofit PV solar projects in the commercial, institutional and residential sectors. Third Sun Solar was founded in 2000 and serves the Midwest (as well as other parts of the U.S.) from their central office in Athens, Ohio and regional office in Cincinnati. Third Sun Solar is a woman-owned business, recognized as a Disadvantaged Business Enterprise (DBE) through the state of Ohio’s Unified Certification Program. The firm is EDGE-certified and federal HUBzone-certified.

name: SunCommon
description: SunCommon’s purpose is to dramatically increase solar energy production in Vermont by finally making it possible to save money by going solar. SunCommon has knocked down the financial barriers to going solar by eliminating the huge upfront costs and replacing them with a monthly payment that is the same or less than what Vermonters are currently paying their utility for electricity. This innovative approach is the outgrowth of a successful pilot program that was operated within the Vermont Public Interest Research Group, the state’s largest non-profit consumer and environmental advocacy organization. Chartered as Vermont’s ninth Benefit Corporation, SunCommon attends to the triple bottom line of people, planet, and profit. They gauge their success not only by the profit they make, but also by their ability to do right by their workers, the communities in which they operate, and the habitats that sustains them.

Renewable Choice offers products and services to measure emissions, manage reduction opportunities, and report to voluntary and mandatory programs. Their experience in supporting more than 3,000 clients to measure, understand, and offset their environmental impact has enabled them to develop tools, processes, and skills to efficiently and cost-effectively deliver customized solutions on a broad scale.
